results.title: The Art of the potter
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, David Outerbridge and Sidney Reichman
results.brief_description: This film presents the work of English potter Bernard Leach and Japanese potter Shoji hamada. Shows each potter demonstrating and discussing his craft, beginning with the digging of clay through to its firing in a kiln. Suitable for Upper Secondary students.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phoenix Films, David Outerbridge and Sidney Reichman

results.title: The Art of the motion picture
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film defines and gives examples of the five basic elements in film making that lend themselves to artistic control by the film maker, and the critical analysis by the film “consumer”; composition, lighting, editing, filming of movement and the use of sound. The film maker uses these to express his ideas with artistic selection and sensitivity.
results.description: This film defines and gives examples of the five basic elements in film making that lend themselves to artistic control by the film maker, and the critical analysis by the film “consumer”; composition, lighting, editing, filming of movement and the use of sound. The film maker uses these to express his ideas with artistic selection and sensitivity.

results.title: The Art of the Japanese package
results.brief_description: This film shows some fine examples of the traditional Japanese art of packaging with natural materials. Based upon “the Art of the Japanese Package” exhibition which toured Australia in 1979-1980. Suitable for Upper Primary-Lower Secondary students.

results.title: The Art of the child
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: An exposition of child art as practised at home and at school by children of all ages. This film includes a visit to the National Exhibition of children’s art to see the variety of exciting works by young people.

results.title: The Art of Ping Pong
results.brief_description: The Art of Ping Pong, by Bristol based artist Jono Sandilands, utilises projection mapping of a ping pong table to record player interactions and create multimedia art installations.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

results.description: The Art of Ping Pong, by Bristol based artist Jono Sandilands, utilises projection mapping of a ping pong table to record player interactions and create multimedia art installations.

results.title: The Art of negotiating (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ian Latimer, Rank Audio Visual and Jeff Inman
results.brief_description: This film is designed to teach the four main phases which occur during the negotiation process in a commercial or business setting: preparation, discussion, proposals and bargaining. Through the use of a clever analogy between domestic and work situations, this film shows how all negotiations ultimately come down to a question of civilised bargaining.

results.title: The Art of ise paper patterns
results.brief_description: The patterns of the Japanese Kimono consist of woven or dyed patterns. Most of the dye patterns have been manufactured by traditional ways of carefully prepared pattern paper. Shown is the outstanding technique of Japanese pattern paper engraving. No other credits available.
results.description: The patterns of the Japanese Kimono consist of woven or dyed patterns. Most of the dye patterns have been manufactured by traditional ways of carefully prepared pattern paper. Shown is the outstanding technique of Japanese pattern paper engraving. No other credits available.

results.title: The Art of hockey umpiring
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the rules of men’s hockey including such pre match responsibilities of the umpire as personal equipment, dress, ground markings and the extent of the playing area under is jurisdiction. An investigation into common infringements of the rules as seen in context with the game. No other credits available.
